docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton said Wednesday that Republican rivals Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio would "slash" spending on projects to fix aging roads and bridges, urging Congress to pass a plan to rebuild the nation's transportation system.

docs.lead_paragraph: A political confidant of President Bill Clinton who held the foreign policy post at a moment when the U.S. was viewed as the world’s sole superpower.
docs.snippet: A political confidant of President Bill Clinton who held the foreign policy post at a moment when the U.S. was viewed as the world’s sole superpower....
docs.abstract: Samuel R Berger, political confidant of Pres Bill Clinton who, as his national security adviser, helped usher in period of fundamental transition in American foreign policy, dies at age 70; during his White House service, Berger was considered among the most influential national security advisers since Henry A Kissinger.

headline.print_headline: Samuel Berger, Adviser to Clinton Who Shaped Foreign Ties, Dies at 70
headline.main: Samuel Berger, Adviser to Clinton Who Shaped Foreign Ties, Dies at 70

docs.lead_paragraph: This dancer-puppeteer-choreographer-carpenter has brought many of his skills to creating a home for performance and study in Clinton Hill.
docs.snippet: This dancer-puppeteer-choreographer-carpenter has brought many of his skills to creating a home for performance and study in Clinton Hill....
docs.abstract: Dancer and choreographer Pepper Fajans opens Brooklyn Studios for Dance, space for teaching and performing dance, in Cadman Congregational Church in Brooklyn Heights; made arrangement with church to work as custodian in exchange for free long term access to its gymnasium.

headline.main: Pepper Fajans Makes Brooklyn Studios for Dance a Blessed Refuge

docs.lead_paragraph: The family of Glen Doherty, one of four Americans killed in the 2012 attack in Libya, is waiting for the C.I.A. to fulfill an agreement made a year ago.
docs.snippet: The family of Glen Doherty, one of four Americans killed in the 2012 attack in Libya, is waiting for the C.I.A. to fulfill an agreement made a year ago....
docs.abstract: Payment of death benefits from Central Intelligence Agency continues to be delayed for family of Glen Doherty, CIA contractor and former Navy SEAL who died in 2012 terrorist attack in Benghazi, Libya; fight by Doherty's family has been overshadowed by politics surrounding congressional investigation of attack on diplomatic compound, along with confusion over administrative policies restricting death benefits for CIA contractors who leave behind no spouse or children.

headline.print_headline: Payout Late in Case of C.I.A. Contractor Killed in Benghazi
headline.main: Family of American Killed in Benghazi Awaits Promised Funds

docs.lead_paragraph: Samuel "Sandy" Berger, a U.S. national security adviser to President Bill Clinton whose reputation was later marred by his theft of classified documents after leaving office, died early on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Former national security adviser Sandy Berger, who helped craft President Bill Clinton's foreign policy and got in trouble over destroying classified documents, died Wednesday.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: As the Islamic State becomes a top concern among those casting ballots, many are evaluating candidates on how they might react to an act of terror.
docs.snippet: As the Islamic State becomes a top concern among those casting ballots, many are evaluating candidates on how they might react to an act of terror....
docs.abstract: Polls and interviews with American voters indicate that recent terrorist attacks by Islamic State are pushing some, in certain regions and demographics, to side with 2016 presidential candidates promoting strong wartime strategies; some point to earlier leaders like Ronald Reagan, while others cite Hollywood hits portraying fictional American presidents, courageously triumphant over terrorists.

headline.print_headline: Skittish Over Terrorism, Some Voters Seek a Gutsy Style of Leader
headline.main: Voters, Worried About Terrorism, Look for Leaders at Home on Silver Screen

docs.snippet: A new national poll from Quinnipiac University finds Mr. Trump and Mrs. Clinton solidifying their positions in their respective races. Ben Carson, one of Mr. Trump’s central rivals who had been challenging him in recent polls, dropped into third...
docs.abstract: A new national poll from Quinnipiac University finds Mr. Trump and Mrs. Clinton solidifying their positions in their respective races. Ben Carson, one of Mr. Trump’s central rivals who had been challenging him in recent polls, dropped into third place.

headline.main: Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton Endure as Ben Carson Recedes, Poll Says
